intro: Vrydagzynea lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved vrydagzynea, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many plants adapted to fire-prone environments. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in spikes. Due to its specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
